reasoning: Autoimmune destruction of adrenal cortex accounts for ~70-80% of primary adrenal insufficiency in developed countries. Prevalence estimated at ~5 per 100k based on epidemiological studies. Limited 2005-specific data; using contemporary estimates from endocrinology literature. Chronic condition appropriately measured by prevalence rather than incidence.
source: Betterle C et al. (2002). Autoimmune adrenal insufficiency and autoimmune polyendocrine syndromes: autoantibodies, autoantigens, and their applicability in diagnosis and disease prediction. Endocr Rev. 23(3):327-364
